contentrichtext.text: [[Image:Gramm Records (logo).png|right|Gramm Records]] '''Gramm''' was an [[Iceland]]ic [[record label]] created by [[Ásmundur Jónsson]] and [[Einar Örn Benediktsson]] in [[1981 in music|1981]]. Located in [[Reykjavík]], Gramm’s first release was a 10-track 7" vinyl titled ''[[Tilf]]'' by [[Purrkur Pillnikk]], a [[Punk rock|punk]] group led by Einar Örn. Besides releasing all Purrkur Pillnikk’ records, Gramm also issued works of artists like the [[England|English]] experimental group [[Psychic TV]], [[Björk]]s first band [[Tappi Tíkarrass]] and [[KUKL (band)|KUKL]] (featuring Björk and Einar Örn). There were others like the legendary rock band [[Þeyr]], punk groups such as [[Vonbrigði]] and others. In [[1987 in music|1987]] Gramm went bankrupt. Ásmundur and some of the musicians who were playing in KUKL created Smekkleysa, that ultimately became [[Bad Taste (record label)|Bad Taste]], worldwide known by [[The Sugarcubes]]. == See also== * [[List of record labels]] * [[Gramm discography]] ==External links== * [http://www.smekkleysa.net Official site] '''NOTE:''' This article features Icelandic characters.
